Meaning of the Hebrew intensive of the s.text: The intensive binyan of the shoresh קדש can mean "to produce a stage called

between a man and a woman." Kiddushin is a stage prior to full marriage (called nisuyin) in which the woman is halachically designated to the man. It can also mean to make something holy, as in "mekadesh ha'shabbos."
